title: Jesse Trevino, painter who persevered after Vietnam War injuries, dies at 76
description: Mr. Trevino lost his right arm after an explosion. He had to relearn to paint with his non-dominant arm.

title: Protesters storm Suriname parliament over high fuel prices
description: Hundreds of demonstrators stormed Suriname’s parliament, broke windows and looted nearby businesses to protest high fuel and electricity prices in the South American nation

title: At awkward meeting, Putin and Lukashenko avoid the war, stress economic ties
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin made clear that he saw a news conference in which the Belarusian leader, Alexander Lukashenko, said he would join the war in Ukraine only if attacked.

title: Doctors Without Borders suspends operations in Burkina Faso
description: Aid group Doctors Without Borders says it’s suspending non-emergency services in Burkina Faso after two of its staff were killed there

title: Judge: Canada right to invoke emergency act in truck protest
description: A public commission says Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau’s government met the “very high threshold” for invoking the Emergencies Act to quell the paralyzing protests by truckers and others angry over Canada’s COVID-19 restrictions last winter

title: Why are the U.K. and E.U. still fighting over Brexit and Northern Ireland?
description: British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak traveled to Belfast amid speculation a deal could soon be struck to address objections.

title: Dog vs shark standoff thrills tourists on Bahamas boat tour
description: Tourists in the Bahamas witnessed a rare standoff between a dog and a shark this week

title: 33 million kids vaccinated against polio in southern Africa
description: The World Health Organization says that more than 33 million children in several southern African countries have been vaccinated against polio, part of ongoing efforts to eradicate the infectious paralytic disease that has been largely contained in much of the world

title: Facing anger after quakes, Syrians in Turkey wonder again: Where do we go?
description: Already used to discrimination in Turkey before the quakes, Syrians now face new insecurity, and are wrestling with the familiar question of what to do next.

title: US says IS commander killed, troops wounded in NE Syria raid
description: The U.S. military says a helicopter raid conducted by its armed forces in northeast Syria has left a senior leader with the Islamic State group dead and four American service members wounded

title: 18 bodies found in abandoned truck in Bulgaria
description: Police in Bulgaria have discovered an abandoned truck containing the bodies of 18 people who are believed to be migrants who suffocated to death

title: Taliban: Former Afghan female lawmaker’s killer arrested
description: A Taliban spokesman says security forces have arrested a man allegedly behind the killing of Afghan female lawmaker Mursal Nabizada

title: Nigeria police deploy for security before presidential vote
description: Nigeria’s top police official says at least 400,000 security forces are being deployed to ramp up safety across the West African nation ahead of its Feb. 25 presidential election

title: Hobbyists are missing a pico balloon. Did a U.S. fighter jet shoot it down?
description: Hobbyists like the Northern Illinois Bottlecap Balloon Brigade typically launch small, tracked "pico balloons" into the sky.

title: Nigeria police deploy for security before presidential vote
description: Nigeria’s top police official says at least 400,000 security forces are being deployed to ramp up safety across the West African nation ahead of its Feb. 25 presidential election

title: Official: Jamaica's PM will not be charged following probe
description: A top prosecutor in Jamaica has ruled that Prime Minister Andrew Holness won’t face charges over possible conflict of interest in contracts awarded to a construction company in 2007-2009 while he was education minister

title: Battered by Cheneso, Madagascar braces for Cyclone Freddy
description: Two weeks after Tropical Cyclone Cheneso devastated Madagascar, leaving 30 dead, the Indian Ocean island nation and its neighbors are bracing for a more powerful Cyclone Freddy

title: Poor Pakistanis worry IMF bailout measures risk stark future
description: Economists say cash-strapped Pakistan’s latest plan for economic recovery is likely to take a painful toll on its poor

title: Blast at Slovenia fireworks company kills 1, injures 2
description: Police say an explosion at a fireworks company in central Slovenia has killed at least one person and seriously injured two

title: Leaked files reveal reputation-management firm’s deceptive tactics
description: Forbidden Stories consortium: Bogus copyright claims, search engine manipulation among disinformation tactics used by the Spain based reputation-management firm

title: Trains, ferries canceled because of storm over Nordics
description: A North Sea storm has led to dozens of cancellations of train and ferry connections in northern Denmark and southern Norway, with the Danish Meteorological Institute saying some gusts could be hurricane force

title: Japan PM apologizes to LGBTQ activists over ex-aide's remark
description: Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida has met with LGBTQ representatives and offered an apology over his former aide’s discriminatory remarks, which sparked nationwide outrage and calls for the government to ensure equal rights

title: Turkish quake victims sleep in trains, tents, greenhouses
description: Hundreds of thousands of people are seeking shelter after the Feb. 6 earthquake in southern Turkey left homes unlivable

title: Brazil's Carnival finally reborn in full form after pandemic
description: Brazil’s Carnival is back

title: Need time off work for period pain? These countries offer ‘menstrual leave.’
description: Spain is the first European country to offer paid menstrual leave, joining several Asian nations that give workers the right to take time off for period pain.

title: Ukraine live briefing: Harris to affirm U.S. commitment to Kyiv; heavy fighting continues in Bakhmut
description: Vice President Harris is addressing the Munich Security Conference days before the anniversary of the invasion, with fierce fighting expected in spring.

title: Australia to vote on giving Indigenous peoples a voice in Parliament
description: Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders, the First Nations people of Australia, want to change the constitution so their message "From the Heart" is heard.

title: Key developments in the aftermath of the Turkey, Syria quake
description: The Turkish disaster management agency has updated the death toll from the powerful earthquake in Turkey to 38,044, raising the overall number of fatalities in both Turkey and Syria to 41,732

title: Ukrainian refugees safe, but not at peace, after year of war
description: Nearly a year has passed since the Feb. 24, 2022, invasion sent millions of people fleeing across Ukraine’s border into neighboring countries

title: New Zealand cyclone fatalities reach 8; more deaths feared
description: The death toll from New Zealand’s cyclone has reached eight with more than 4,500 people still unaccounted for four days after the nation’s most destructive weather event in decades brought widespread flooding, landslides and power outages

title: Abu Dhabi state gas company to sell 4% of shares in IPO
description: The Abu Dhabi National Oil Company’s gas processing firm plans to sell 4% of its shares to local investors in the latest initial public offering to be made by a state-run energy company in the Middle East

title: Tokyo Olympic bribery trial opens; accused accepts guilt
description: A trial looking into bribery at the Tokyo Olympic organizing committee has begun

title: In wake of Ukraine war, U.S. and allies are hunting down Russian spies
description: Since the start of the war in Ukraine, U.S. and European security service have been waging a campaign to root out Russian spy networks on the continent.

title: Indian child marriage crackdown leaves families in anguish
description: Nureja Khatun’s husband is one of more than 3,000 men who have been arrested in the northeastern state of Assam under a wide crackdown on illegal child marriages involving girls under the age of 18

title: A year after invasion, has Russia already lost?
description: The war has been a disaster for Russia. ”They’ve lost strategically, operationally and tactically,” said Gen. Mark A. Milley, chairman of the Joint Chiefs.
